intro: Daviesia coluteoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It is typically found in sandy or loamy soils in open woodlands and heathlands. Daviesia coluteoides is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
